title: Mango Yogurt Mousse
ingredients: 2 cups fresh mango puree (about 2 peeled and pitted mangoes) plus mango slices as a garnish
instructions: In a small saucepan sprinkle the gelatin over ¼ cup cold water, let it soften for 1 minute, and heat the mixture over low heat, stirring, until the gelatin is dissolved.  In a blender blend together the mango puree, the sugar, and the vanilla, then add the gelatin mixture and blend the mixture well.  Transfer the mixture to a bowl and stir in the yogurt.  In a chilled bowl beat the cream until it holds stiff peaks.  Fold the whipped cream into the mango mixture gently but thoroughly and divide the mousse among 4 dessert glasses.
Chill the mousses for at least 4 hours or overnight.  Garnish each glass with the mango slices.
Source:  Cuisine Courante:  A Luncheon in Bermuda, Gourmet Magazine, May 1991.
